property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]]'s Lab. Both she and [[Mettaton]] make their first appearances here, but on the [[Genocide Route]], only Mettaton makes an appearance. Contains a secret entrance to the [[True Lab]].

property.name: description
property.value: Hotel owned by [[Mettaton]]. On the [[Genocide Route]], the resort is evacuated, and no NPCs are present. It directly connects to the [[CORE]].

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort

property.name: description
property.value: [[Undyne]] chases the protagonist into Hotland, where she collapses due to excessive heat. The protagonist can pour water on her from the nearby water cooler, which allows her to be befriended at [[Undyne's House|her house]].

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can grab a cup of water from the cooler, which evaporates when the protagonist leaves the room. They can dump out the water onto the ground next to the cooler, which forms a puddle that grows in size as more water is dumped out. At the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]], a small tree groes from the puddle if all the water has been dumped out.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] bursts through the wall and subjects the protagonist to a quiz show, during which [[Alphys]] helps them answer his questions.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] is present in the lab. He explains that [[Alphys]] had already evacuated everyone in Hotland to a safe location prior to the protagonist's arrival. He retreats shortly afterward and is only seen again in the [[CORE]].

property.name: description
property.value: A video feed of the protagonist's location. It tracks the protagonist's movements.

property.name: description
property.value: Alphys upgrades the protagonist's phone to include [[Dimensional Box]] functionalities and adds a second box for the protagonist to use. She then retreats into her "bathroom."

property.name: description
property.value: Initiially disguised as a bathroom, this door reveals an elevator that leads down into the True Lab. It can only be opened on the [[True Pacifist Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: True Lab

property.name: description
property.value: After delivering [[Undyne's Letter]] to the [[Lab]] door, [[Alphys]] initiates a date with the protagonist. The date concludes in the [[Garbage Dump]], after which the Lab door unlocks.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] subjects the protagonist to a cooking show and asks them to retrieve sugar, milk, and eggs from the counter behind him. He then directs the protagonist to the can on the counter to the right, which rockets upwards. [[Alphys]] activates the jetpack on the protagonist's phone, allowing them to attempt to claim it while Mettaton impedes their progress.

property.name: description
property.value: On the [[Genocide Route]], the second floor of Hotland is blocked off by force fields, preventing access.

object.name: Hidden path to the Art Club Room

property.name: description
property.value: An invisible pathway to the [[Art Club Room]], made of tiles of magic glass.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] conducts a news report of the area and asks the protagonist to report on one of six available objects. He then reveals that every object was a bomb and tasks the protagonist with defusing them all before the time runs out. [[Alphys]] points out the bomb defusal program on their phone.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] performs a musical for the protagonist and dropes them down into the room containing the [[Multicolor Tile Puzzle]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton]] tasks the protagonist with completing the [[Multicolor Tile Puzzle]] before the time runs out, after which he launches an attack. [[Alphys]] tells the protagonist to press the [[SOUL Modes#Yellow|yellow button]] on their phone, which allows them to counterattack and force Mettaton to retreat.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Sans]] offers to take the protagonist to the restaurant inside the [[MTT Resort]]. He leads them through a "shortcut," which teleports them straight there.

property.name: description
property.value: Entrance to the CORE, which leads directly to [[New Home]].

property.name: description
property.value: This door can be unlocked by speaking to the Hand Receptionist and paying for a room to stay in.

property.name: description
property.value: On the [[Genocide Route]], the second floor of Hotland is blocked off by force fields, preventing access.

property.name: description
property.value: Sells hot dogs for 30G. The second hot dog bought is revealed to be a Hot Cat. If the protagonist has a full inventory, Sans stacks up to 30 hot dogs on their head free of charge.

property.name: page
property.value: Hot Dog...?

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy a Spider Donut for 9999G.

property.name: page
property.value: Spider Donut

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy a Spider Cider for 9999G.

property.name: page
property.value: Spider Cider

property.name: description
property.value: Sells [[Nice Cream]] for 12G if the [[Royal Guards]] were killed. If they were spared, they will have bought out his entire stock, preventing the protagonist from buying any Nice Cream.

property.name: page
property.value: Nice Cream Guy

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy items from the shop inside the alleyway.

property.name: page
property.value: Bratty and Catty

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy items inside the MTT Brand Burger Emporium.

property.name: description
property.value: A Dimensional Box inside the [[MTT Resort]], only available on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Dimensional Box

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must unlock this door by solving the puzzles to the left and right. To solve the puzzles, the protagonist must maneuver the boxes so that they can shoot the opposing ship. Here, the protagonist is given two rounds of ammunition for each puzzle. On the [[Genocide Route]], this door is already open.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/Puzzles#Reactivated Door Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: Can be solved by entering ''up'', ''left'', ''down'', and ''left''.

property.name: description
property.value: Can be solved by entering either ''up'' or ''down'', then ''left'' or ''right''.

property.name: description
property.value: To deactivate the force field, the protagonist must press the three switches within three seconds. If the protagonist misses the timing, they must ride the conveyor belt back to the beginning and start again.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/Puzzles#The Conveyor Belt Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must navigate the puzzle by pressing the buttons to reorient the vents.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must solve the puzzles to the north and south in order to unlock this door. They are given only one round of ammunition for each puzzle. On the [[Genocide Route]], this door is already open.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/Puzzles#Reactivated Door Puzzle_2

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can solve this puzzle by entering ''left'', ''up'', ''left'', ''left'', ''right''.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can solve this puzzle by entering ''left'', ''right''.

properties.property: Seeing such a strange laboratory in a place like this... You're filled with determination.

property.name: description
property.value: ''The whooshing sound of steam and cogs... it fills you with determination.''

properties.property: An [[CORE|ominous structure]] looms in the distance... You're filled with determination.
Knowing the mouse might one day hack the computerized safe and get the cheese... It fills you with determination.
The smell of cobwebs fills the air... You're filled with determination.

property.name: description
property.value: ''The relaxing atmosphere of this hotel... it fills you with determination.''

properties.property: ALPHYS updated status. just realized i didn't watch [[undyne]] fight the human v.v
ALPHYS updated status. well i know she's unbeatable i'll ask her abt it later ^.^
ALPHYS updated status. for now i gotta call up the human and guide them =^.^=
ALPHYS updated status. gonna call them in a minute!!! =^.^=
ALPHYS updated status. I HATE USING THE PHONE I DON'T WANT TO DO THIS LMAO ^.^
ALPHYS updated status. omg ive had my claw over the last digit for 5 minutes omg i'm just gonna do it i'm just gonna call!!!!

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and immediately hangs up before they can answer it.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and teaches the protagonist about how to avoid the [[Attack Types#Light Blue Attack|blue]] and [[Attack Types#Orange Attack|orange]] lasers.

properties.property: ALPHYS updated status. OMG I DID IT!!! claws haven't shook like that since [[undyne]] called me to ask about the weather... v.v
ALPHYS updated status. WAIT THERE'S NO WEATHER DOWN HERE WHY DID SHE CALL ME
ALPHYS updated status. Oh My God i Forgot to Tell THem Where To Go

ALPHYS posted a picture. CUte PIC OF ME RIGHT NOW ^.^
(It's a photo of a garbage can with several pink, glittery filters over it.)

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and warns them of the upcoming puzzles. She directs them to the puzzle on the right.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and notes the blue laser in their way. She deactivates the laser, which allows the protagonist to complete the puzzle.

properties.property: ALPHYS updated status. wonder if it would be unfun if i explained the puzzle...
ALPHYS updated status. whatever!!! i'll just explain it!!!

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and attempts to explain the puzzle, only to realize that they had already solved it.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and explains that the structure in the distance is the [[CORE]], and it contains an elevator that leads straight to [[New Home]].

properties.property:
ALPHYS posted a picture. dinner with the girlfriend ;)
(It's a picture of a catgirl figurine next to a bowl of instant noodles.)

CoolSkeleton95 posted a picture. ARE WE POSTING HOT "PICS???" HERE IS ME AND MY COOL FRIEND
(It's a picture of [[Papyrus]] flexing in front of a mirror. He is wearing sunglasses.) (Giant muscular biceps are pasted onto his arms.) (The biceps are also wearing sunglasses.)
ALPHYS updated status. LOL, CoolSkeleton95! ... that's a joke, right?
CoolSkeleton95 updated status. THE ONLY JOKE HERE, IS HOW STRONG MY MUSCLES ARE.

property.name: description
property.value: NAPSTABLOOK22 sends a friend request to the protagonist, but it is immediately withdrawn before they can accept or reject it.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and explains the timing-based puzzle. She offers to help the protagonist with the timing.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist as they attempt to press the last switch, causing them to miss the timing. Alphys manually deactivates the force field blocking the way.

properties.property: ALPHYS updated status. that's the last time i try to help with a puzzle lmao

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and announces that she has to use the bathroom. She leaves the protagonist to solve the upcoming puzzle without assistance.

properties.property: ALPHYS updated status. OMG? ppl think Mew Mew 2 is better than Mew Mew 1? LOLLLLL that's a joke right...
ALPHYS updated status. omg... DONT THEY GET IT RUINS Mew Mew's ENTIRE CHARACTER ARC
ALPHYS updated status. My Mew Mew 2 Review: Mew Mew Kissie Cutie 2 Is Neither Kissy Nor Cutie. It's Trash. 0 stars
ALPHYS updated status. oopswait how's the human doing
ALPHYS updated status. Top 10 Shows That Make You Forget To Do Your Frickin Job

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and notes their silence. She assumes that they are worried about [[Asgore Dreemurr|Asgore]] and reassure them that he is a nice person.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and informs them of the puzzles to the north and south. She invites them to send her a message on UnderNet before realizing that the protagonist had been reading her messages since their phone was upgraded.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Alphys]] calls the protagonist and asks them if they would want to watch anime with her.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears the second time the protagonist enters this room. He explains how he wanted to get a drink from the water cooler.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Clam Guy

property.name: description
property.value: Can ferry the protagonist to either [[Snowdin]] or [[Waterfall]].

property.name: page
property.value: River Person

property.name: description
property.value: The Royal Guards initially block the way to elevator L1. They explain that they are on watch for any humans that enter the area.

property.name: page
property.value: Royal Guards

property.name: description
property.value: [[Mettaton EX]]'s body can be seen on the [[True Pacifist Route]] undergoing repairs.

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Vulkin]] appears after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. They comment on how the protagonist's hugs make them feel "spicey."

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Pyrope]] appears here after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. They claim to have set the lava on fire and comment that it is now "spicey."

property.name: description
property.value: Is seen loitering behind the laser. She says that she will continue loitering despite the laser being deactivated.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Fuku Fire

property.name: description
property.value: Is seen loitering behind the laser. Expresses relief at the possibility that school would be canceled due to the reactivated puzzles before realizing that school is on break anyway.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Skateboard Girl

property.name: description
property.value: Says that they are watching [[Mettaton]]'s show due to the way to work being blocked.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Business Dudes

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that they are a member of [[Mettaton]]'s fan club, which has at least three dozen members.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Business Dudes

property.name: description
property.value: Struggles to complete the puzzle and complains that their co-workers are doing nothing to help.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Fox Head

property.name: description
property.value: Has a 20% chance of appearing if the [[Fun Value]] is 61. Mentions how [[W.D. Gaster]], the Royal Scientist preceding [[Alphys]], suddenly vanished without a trace, shattering across time and space. They claim to be holding a piece of him and abruptly vanish.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Gaster Follower 2

property.name: description
property.value: Asks the protagonist to remember their name.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Heats Flamesman

property.name: description
property.value: Notes the oddity of snow on the sentry station roof, but writes it off as [[Sans]] being too lazy to clean it off.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Hot Dog Harpy

property.name: description
property.value: Is eagerly enjoying its hot dog.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Hot Dog Vulkin

property.name: description
property.value: Appears at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]] if they were fought.

property.name: page
property.value: So Sorry

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Tsunderplane]] appears here after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. Invites the protagonist to stand closer after initially rebuffing them, referring to the action as "spicey."

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Pyrope]] appears here after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. They invite the protagonist to hang out before claiming that they are too "spicey" to have any friends.

property.name: description
property.value: Has a 50% chance of appearing if the [[Fun Value]] is 63. They mention that the life of [[W.D. Gaster]], the Royal Scientist preceding [[Alphys]], was cut short after his experiments went wrong. They then stop talking after implying that he is listening.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Gaster Follower 3

property.name: description
property.value: Has a 50% chance to appear if the [[Fun Value]] is 61. Mentions how [[W.D. Gaster]], the Royal Scientist preceding [[Alphys]], was responsible for constructing the [[CORE]], but his life was cut short after falling into his creation.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Gaster Follower 1

property.name: description
property.value: Hosts the [[Spider Bake Sale]] in Hotland.

property.name: description
property.value: They were scammed into buying a donut for all of their cash.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Scared Donut Guy

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Tsunderplane]] appears here after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. Accuses the protagonist of following it before also accusing them of thinking that it is not "spicey" enough for them.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after clearing the top shooting puzzle. He provides a hint on how to gain ratings during the battle against [[Mettaton EX]]: "when everything looks the baddest, he poses dramatically."

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Diamond Boys

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after clearing the top shooting puzzle. He provides a hint on how to gain ratings during the battle against [[Mettaton EX]]: "beats up the heel-turning villains."

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Diamond Boys

property.name: description
property.value: Appears after [[Mettaton]]'s musical. They wish to have a dress like Mettaton's. Mettaton gives them his dress at the end of the [[True Pacifist Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Dress Lion

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Vulkin]] appears here after receiving [[Undyne's Letter]]. They comment on how the protagonist's encouragements make them feel "spicey."

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Royal Guards]] appear here if they were spared, having bought out the [[Nice Cream Guy]]'s entire stock of [[Nice Cream]]. They ask the protagonist not to tell [[Undyne]] whet they are doing.

property.name: description
property.value: Asks the protagonist if they remembered their name. They express shock regardless of the protagonist's answer.

property.name: page
property.value: Hotland/NPCs#Heats Flamesman

property.name: description
property.value: Welcomes the protagonist to the [[MTT Resort]].

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Diamond Receptionist

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that the elevator to the capital has stopped working and that the resort is trying to accomodate everyone trying to access it.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Business Manticore

property.name: description
property.value: Is calling their family to let them know that they will not be getting home in time since the elevator is out of order.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Sad Dragon

property.name: description
property.value: Expresses outrage that the elevator is out of order.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Shambling Mass

property.name: description
property.value: Offers a stay at the hotel for 200G.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Hand Receptionist

property.name: description
property.value: Informs the protagonist that they have to reserve a table to eat at the restaurant.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Fish Receptionist

property.name: description
property.value: The father of [[Snowdrake]] and a comedian at the [[MTT Resort]]. He explains that since Snowdrake ran away from home after [[Snowdrake's Mother|his mother]] fell down.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Snowdrake's Father

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that the [[CORE]] is made up of freely swappable parts, allowing them to change the layout as necessary.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Charles

property.name: description
property.value: Complains about the excess of puzzles in the [[Underground]], a tradition originating from when [[monsters]] would construct puzzles to deter attacks from [[humans]].

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Oni

property.name: description
property.value: They forgot to make a reservation to the restaurant, so they stand in the corner licking the nearby ficus so as to not look like they messed up.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#Ficus Licker

property.name: description
property.value: Is constantly cleaning off the slime drooping from their body.

property.name: page
property.value: MTT Resort/NPCs#MTT Resort Janitor

property.name: description
property.value: ''Shoot the opposing ship! Move the boxes to complete your mission.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Shoot the opposing ship! Move the boxes to complete your mission.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Art Club: Meet Here! Next meeting: October 10th 8PM''

property.value: Art Club Room

property.value: ''Shoot the opposing ship! Move the boxes to complete your mission.''

properties.property: Hey! Go up the creepy alleyway on the right for some great deals!
Learning how to draw? Come to the [[Art Club Room|Art Lessons]] on the second floor! Located in a similar place.
Royal Memorial Fountain Built 201X ([[Mettaton]] Added Last Week)

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can grab a package of Instant Noodles from the fridge.

property.name: page
property.value: Instant Noodles

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up the Burnt Pan in this area.

property.value: Burnt Pan

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up the Stained Apron in this area.

property.value: Stained Apron

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can trade a [[Sea Tea]] for 99G.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can trade a [[Cinnamon Bunny]] for 99G.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can trade a [[Hot Dog...?|Hot Dog]] for a [[Hush Puppy]].

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter against a Vulkin.

property.name: description
property.value: Miniboss battle against the Royal Guards on the [[Genocide Route]].

property.value: Royal Guards

property.name: description
property.value: Miniboss battle against the Royal Guards on the [[Neutral Route]].

property.name: page
property.value: Royal Guards

property.name: description
property.value: Boss batle against Muffet. Does not fight if the protagonist donated enough money to the [[Spider Bake Sale]]s.
